conclusion: Analyze how shadows A, B, C, and D will change with light source movement.
Object at position A: A small round pastry/cake with red topping.
Object at position C: A roll of medical tape/bandage with a red cross symbol.
Object at position D: A circular ring/band.
Arrow pointers indicate the shadows cast by these objects.
Current light source position is somewhat to the front left.
Shadows will shift to fall in front and to the left of their respective objects.
Shadows will likely become longer if the light source is at a lower angle.
If the light source moves higher, shadows could become shorter.
Shadow A will shift to fall in front and left of the pastry and likely elongated.
Shadow C will shift to fall in front and left of the roll and cast a differently oriented elongated shadow.
Shadow D will shift to fall in front and left of the ring and cast an oval or elongated shadow.
No clear object labeled as B in the image.
Final answer: Shadows will shift positions and likely become elongated.
